Hello all. I've been playing ksp for over a week now and i'm enjoying every second of it. Everything was running smoothly until today when i ran into an interesting problem.So i've created recently a spaceplane, which has a drogue chute in the back, just to brake when the plane lands. However the chute when deployed, it gets cut(?) and a red parachute icon replaces the one on the left. I thought at first it was because of the exhaust gases of the engines, but after retrying landing and shutting down the engines, the chute still gets cut.Screenshots:

Front view

Back view

Side view

Landing and deploying the chute. As you can see the icon on the left has turned red and there is no visible signs of a parachute.

No chute behind, also.

So, any ideas?

P.S. If this isn't the correct thread sorry, i'm new to the forums.

All parachutes are automatically cut when vertical velocity equals 0. This unfortunately means they cannot be used to stop a vehicle traveling level across the ground, and will also result in the loss of chutes during a powered landing if you begin accelerating upward.

Thanks for the info and the fast reply
YEah they do get cut if your vertical speed hit zero, like what Panic said ^^ but the brakes do work prettty well
Chutes dont work when your Vertical speed reaches 0, if you flare while landing ( back gear touches first) you might be able to get some speed reduction.
The Firespitter mod includes air brakes which you could use instead.
You can assign the chute to an action group to deploy, and it will not cut until you tell it to i believe. I've never tried it, but it's worth a shot.

Nope. It doesn't matter, they still cut when on the ground.

I would love to see a seperate braking chute in game, for use on the ground, depending on horizontal speed (when lower than e.g. 2-3 m/s cut) instead of vertical. Could be useful for improving safety on heavy spaceplanes - while runway at KSC is always long enough, crap may hit the fan and you may end up having 1/3 of runway to stop. That's why IRL shuttles had braking chutes - they could wheelbrake at 4.5 km long runway at SLF without any problem but lower roll is always safier if you can perform it.
